required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Compare Pharmacokinetics of Tacrolimus Prolonged-release (PR) Capsules and Advagraf® PR Capsules in Stable Kidney Transplant Patients.
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Multicenter, Open-Label, Two-period, Two-sequence Crossover Comparative Pharmacokinetic Study of Generic Tacrolimus (Sandoz) and Advagraf® in Stable Renal Transplant Patients (TODAY)

brief_summary.textblock: Study to compare pharmacokinetics of tacrolimus prolonged-release (PR) capsules and Advagraf® PR capsules in stable kidney transplant patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Initially, patients will enter a short screening period, and those who continue to meet the inclusion and exclusion criteria will be randomized to receive either test or reference medicinal product in Period 1. In period 2 they will switch to the other formulation. During the whole treatment period four full-pharmacokinetics profiles will be established.

primary_outcome.description: Area under the whole blood concentration curve during a dosage interval (τ=24 hours) at steady state
Maximum whole blood concentration at steady state

secondary_outcome.description: Area under the whole blood concentration curve during a dosage interval (τ=24 hours) at steady state
Maximum whole blood concentration at steady state

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 14 and 21 of each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Minimum whole blood concentration at steady state

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 14 and 21 of each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Concentration at the end of the dosing interval at steady state

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 14 and 21 of each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Average concentration during a dosing interval: AUC(0-τ)/τ

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 14 and 21 of each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Time to reach maximum (peak) plasma concentration at steady state

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 14 and 21 of each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Intra-patient pharmacokinetics variability evaluated by calculating AUC(0-τ)ss coefficient of variation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 14 and 21 of each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Intra-patient pharmacokinetics variability evaluated by calculating Cmax,ss coefficient of variation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 14 and 21 of each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Degree of fluctuation of the analyte concentration levels over one dosing interval: 100*(Cmax,ss − Cmin,ss)/Cav.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 14 and 21 of each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Degree of change of the analyte concentration levels over one dosing interval: 100*(Cmax,ss - Cτ,ss)/Cτ,ss.

arm_group.description: In Period 1 patients will receive branded tacrolimus (Advagraf®) orally once-a-day and in Period 2 patients will receive the generic tacrolimus (Sandoz) orally once-a-day.
In Period 1 patients will receive the generic tacrolimus (Sandoz) orally once-a-day and in Period 2 patients will receive branded tacrolimus (Advagraf®) orally once-a-day.

intervention.description: Advagraf®1 mg and 5 mg prolonged-release hard capsules once daily (reference medicinal product).
Tacrolimus 1 mg and 5 mg prolonged release hard capsules (Sandoz) once daily (test medicinal product)
